item.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR 11/19/2003 H11468)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR 11/19/2003 H11468)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1189.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR 11/19/2003 H11468-11469)
Mr. Souder moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 61.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-119.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-119.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

item.fullName: Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 1189, A bill to increase the waiver requirement for certain local matching requirements for grants provided to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, or the Commwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Resources on May 7, 2003

item.title: H.R. 1189, A bill to increase the waiver requirement for certain local matching requirements for grants provided to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, or the Commwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Resources on May 7, 2003

summary.text:
Amends Federal law to require U.S. agencies with respect to the award of grants to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands to waive: (1) the entire local matching fund requirement, if any, for grants of $500,000 or less (including in-kind contributions); and (2) $500,000 of any local matching fund requirement for grants of more than $500,000 (including in-kind contributions).

Requires the Secretary of the Interior to report to specified congressional committees on the results of a study of the implementation of amendments made by this Act.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Amends Federal law to require U.S. agencies with respect to the award of grants to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands to waive: (1) the entire local matching fund requirement, if any, for grants of $500,000 or less (including in-kind contributions); and (2) $500,000 of any local matching fund requirement for grants of more than $500,000 (including in-kind contributions).

Requires the Secretary of the Interior to report to specified congressional committees on the results of a study of the implementation of amendments made by this Act.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Amends Federal law to require U.S. agencies with respect to the award of grants to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands to waive: (1) the entire local matching fund requirement, if any, for grants of $500,000 or less (including in-kind contributions); and (2) $500,000 of any local matching fund requirement for grants of more than $500,000 (including in-kind contributions).

Requires the Secretary of the Interior to report to specified congressional committees on the results of a study of the implementation of amendments made by this Act.

bill.title: To increase the waiver requirement for certain local matching requirements for grants provided to American Samoa, Guam, the Virgin Islands, or the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
